Waves from merging massive black holes c: Can waves from merging massive black holes be detected? Detection of waves from merging massive black holes

Caption: A computer simulation shows the collision of two black holes, a tremendously powerful event detected for the first time ever by the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory, or LIGO. LIGO detected gravitational waves, or ripples in space and time, generated as the black holes merged.
Can waves from merging massive black holes be detected? Detection of waves from merging massive black holes

LIGO detected gravitational waves, or ripples in space and time, generated as the black holes merged. The simulation shows what the merger would look like if we could somehow get a closer look. The stars appear warped due to the strong gravity of the black holes.
